definition: contrary/opposite/backwards/to go against/to oppose/to betray/to rebel

sentences.english: Because congenial delight, he and a similar age man become true friendship.
sentences.chinese: 因情趣相投，他和一个年纪相仿的男人成为莫逆之交。

sentences.english: We were friends from that day, until the day he died.
sentences.chinese: 自那天起我们就成了莫逆之交，直到他过世。

sentences.english: Despite their age difference, they became friends.
sentences.chinese: 尽管年龄有差距，两人成为莫逆之交。

sentences.english: The cat and dog may kiss, yet are none the better.
sentences.chinese: 猫犬可相吻，莫逆却难成。

sentences.english: Suspicion is the poison of true friendship.
Many years ago I had a friend, a dear friend.
sentences.chinese: 良多年前，我有一个配头，咱们莫逆之交。

sentences.english: You are the best friend I have in the world and the noblest .
sentences.chinese: 您是我在世界上的最高尚的莫逆之交。

definition: a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
to not get along well/to be at odds
to get along well (with sb)/congenial/to speculate (on financial markets)
